page.title: 02GUITING POWER.HOUSING.
page.content: Our village is different from many other villages, because half the houses belong to a Charitable Trust, 60 out of a total of 120. 270 people approximately live here. The oldest house is thought to be early 16th century. The original Saxon village was round the church, but when the village first had a market in 1330 the Square became the centre. Many of the present houses were built about 1830,when the population rose to 792,as Irish labourers came to work in local quarries, producing stone for roads, railways and houses. The present Lord of the Manor improved all Manor property between 1958 and 1964, and made it over to a Charitable Trust,whose policy is to provide housing at a reasonable rent for local people. Six maintenance workers look after the property.
